data.question: What is the molecular formula of the as synthesized Hf-2?
data.answer: The molecular formula of the as synthesized Hf-2 is (Hf6(μ3-O)4(μ3-OH)4(benzoate)4(FeTCPCl)-4)2) (C124H72Cl2Fe2N8O32Hf6).

data.question: What is the yield percentage of the as synthesized Hf-2?
data.answer: The yield percentage of the as synthesized Hf-2 is approximately 49%.

data.question: What is the BET surface area of Fe@Hf-2 after activation?
data.answer: The BET surface area of Fe@Hf-2 after activation is 1600 m2 g-1.

data.question: What is the role of FeCl3 in the post-metalation of Hf-2 to generate Fe@Hf-2?
data.answer: FeCl3 is used to ensure complete metalation of the porphyrin functionality in Hf-2, leading to the generation of Fe@Hf-2.

data.question: What is the main safety concern when handling Azidotrimethylsilane (TMS-N3) during the tandem reaction of styrene with O2?
data.answer: The main safety concern when handling Azidotrimethylsilane (TMS-N3) is that it is incompatible with moisture, oxidizing agents, and acids, and can easily decompose to hydrolyzed to hydrazoic acid (hydrogen azide), which is extremely toxic and explosive.

data.question: True or False: The Fe@Hf-2 MOF demonstrates catalytic activity with full consumption of the starting material in the desired tandem reaction.
What is the predicted Fe:Hf ratio in the as-synthesized MOF before and after exposure to FeCl3?
data.answer: Before exposure to FeCl3, the Fe:Hf ratio in the as-synthesized MOF is 2:6. After exposure to FeCl3, the Fe:Hf ratio increases to 4:6.

data.question: True or False: The Fe@Hf-2 MOF can be reused in the tandem oxidation reaction without significant loss of activity.
What is the main product formed when 2-(4-vinylphenyl)oxirane reacts under the optimized reaction conditions with Fe@Hf-2 as the catalyst?
True or False: The computational studies suggest that the bis-μ-oxo di-iron functionality on the Hf6 nodes of Fe@Hf-2 is responsible for the observed product in the tandem catalysis.
